[[Legion of Merit]] (United States) |laterwork= }} [[Major General (Australia)|Major General]] '''John Patrick Cantwell''' [[Officer of the Order of Australia|AO]] is a senior officer within the [[Australian Army]]. Cantwell joined the [[Australian Army]] as a regular soldier in 1974. He attended officer training in 1981, and was commissioned into the [[Royal Australian Armoured Corps]].{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} As a [[Major]], Cantwell commanded a British tank squadron as an exchange officer with the British in Germany. As a result of that posting he served in [[Operation Desert Storm]] with the Coalition forces in Saudi Arabia, Iraq and Kuwait between 1990â1991.Horner 2011, p. 425. In August 1996 Cantwell became Commanding Officer and Chief Instructor at the [[Royal Military College, Duntroon]]. In January 1999 he took up an appointment as an instructor at the British [[Joint Services Command and Staff College]] in the United Kingdom, returning to Australia as the Director of the Force Development Group, Land Warfare Development Centre, on promotion to [[Colonel]] in December 2000. Cantwell was promoted to [[Brigadier]] in January 2003 as Director General of Capability and Plans in Australian Defence Headquarters. Following command of the [[1st Brigade (Australia)|1st Brigade]] (2004â2005), in early 2006 he deployed to Iraq as the Director Strategic Operations, Headquarters Multi National Forces Iraq. While on this deployment he was promoted to [[Major General (Australia)|Major General]] on 4 December 2006, and assumed the appointment as Deputy [[Chief of Army (Australia)|Chief of Army]] on 29 January 2007. In February 2008 Cantwell was selected by the [[Angus Houston|Chief of the Defence Force]] to be the senior military member of the team working on a new [http://www.defence.gov.au/whitepaper/ Defence White Paper 2008] the paramount Australian security and defence policy document, commissioned by the Australian Government. Following the Victorian bushfires disaster on 7 February 2009, Cantwell was attached to the Office of the Premier of Victoria as the Interim Head (and later, Chief of Operations) of the [http://www.wewillrebuild.vic.gov.au/ Victorian Bushfires Reconstruction and Recovery Authority] responsible for coordinating all Commonwealth, State and non-government efforts to recover from the effects of the fires. In 2010 he served as Commander of Australian Forces in the Middle East Area of Operations. ==Honours and Awards==
